issue.title: Python: Provide installable sdist builds
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-190](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-190). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
These builds should be uploadable to PyPI and assume libarrow installed.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-190?focusedCommentId=15272676) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I'm fairly -1 on creating a standalone PyPI build from source — as the toolchain grows in size this will become increasingly unsustainable. I agree that one should be able to install pyarrow assuming that libarrow and other library dependencies are installed and on LD_LIBRARY_PATH. I think it would be time better spent creating conda builds for everything (which has superior support for building / installing non-Python dependencies)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-190?focusedCommentId=15273790) by Uwe Korn (uwe):*
PR for the new, smaller scope: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/71
